Name: Heuristic Reasoning - PE
Text: 1 Understand the Goal The objective is to analyze a provided event log for a ProcuretoPay P2P process identify anomalies deviations from standard best practices and explain why they are problematic

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: 2 Understand the Standard P2P Process Before looking at the data I need to establish the Happy Path or standard flow for ProcuretoPay Step 1 Requirement Identification Not always logged but leads to Requisition Step 2 Purchase Requisition PR Creation Internal request to buy something Step 3 Purchase Requisition Approval ManagementFinance approves the spend Crucial Control Point Step 4 Purchase Order PO Issuance Formal legal offer sent to the vendor Crucial Control Point No PO No Pay Step 5 Goods Receipt GR Service Entry Confirmation that what was ordered arrived Step 6 Invoice Receipt Vendor sends the bill Step 7 3Way Match Matching PO GR Invoice Crucial Control Point Step 8 Payment Release Money is sent Step 9 Case Closure Key DependenciesConstraints PR must be approved before PO is issued PO must be issued before Goods are received usually or at least before Invoice Matching Goods should ideally be received before Payment unless advance payment is agreed but standard P2P assumes GR first Invoice should be matched before Payment Approval must happen before Commitment PO

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: 3 Analyze Each Case Individually Case 1001 Create PR Approve PR Issue PO Receive Goods Invoice Received Match Invoice Release Payment Close Timeline Feb 1 to Feb 7 Sequence Logical PR approved before PO PO before Goods Goods before Payment Match before Payment Verdict NormalCompliant Case 1002 Create PR 0830 Issue PO 0840 Invoice Received 0700 next day Release Payment 0715 Approve PR 0800 Receive Goods 0900 next day Match Invoice Close Anomaly 1 PO Issued before PR Approval 0840 vs 0800 next day The PO was sent to the vendor before internal management approved the spend Anomaly 2 Payment Released before PR Approval Payment happened at 0715 Approval at 0800 same day Paying before internal approval is a major control failure Anomaly 3 Payment Released before Goods Received Payment on Feb 3 Goods on Feb 4 While advance payments exist in standard P2P this is risky paying for nothing Anomaly 4 Payment Released before Invoice Matching Payment at 0715 Match at 0800 Feb 5 You paid before verifying the invoice matches the PO Goods Verdict Highly Anomalous High Risk Case 1003 Create PR Approve PR Issue PO Release Payment Feb 8 Invoice Received Feb 9 Receive Goods Feb 10 Match Invoice Close Anomaly 1 Payment Released before Invoice Received You cant match an invoice you havent received Paying based on what Anomaly 2 Payment Released before Goods Received Paying before getting the items Anomaly 3 Payment Released before Matching Matching happens on Feb 11 Payment on Feb 8 Defeats the purpose of matching Verdict Anomalous High Risk Looks like an unauthorized advance payment or data entry error Case 1004 Create PR Approve PR Receive Goods Feb 6 0900 Issue PO Feb 6 0915 Invoice Received Match Invoice Release Payment Close Anomaly 1 Goods Received before PO Issued 0900 vs 0915 This is Maverick Buying The department got the goods before formally ordering them This undermines the negotiation and approval power of the PO Note The PO was issued 15 minutes after goods receipt This suggests retroactive documentation to cover up the unauthorized purchase Verdict Anomalous Compliance Issue

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: 4 Synthesize and Structure the Output Start with a brief definition of the standard P2P flow to set the baseline Go case by case skipping the normal one or mentioning it briefly as a baseline Highlight specific anomalies for the problematic cases Explain the business impactrisk for each anomaly eg fraud risk financial loss audit failure Conclude with a summary of findings

Name: Validation - PE
Text: 5 Refine the Analysis SelfCorrectionDetail Check Case 1002 Make sure to emphasize the approval timestamp Its explicitly after the PO and Payment This is a segregation of dutiesapproval authority violation Case 1003 Emphasize the Payment before Invoice aspect Thats accounting nonsense in a standard accrual system Case 1004 Focus on Maverick Buying Receiving goods before a PO exists means the price and terms werent legally locked in before the liability was incurred Case 1001 Explicitly state this is the control baseline
